paclitaxel.premedication: Dexamethasone 20mg PO/IV, diphenhydramine 50mg IV, ranitidine 50mg IV (prevent hypersensitivity)

soc_recommendation.schedule: Every 3 weeks for 6 cycles (carboplatin + paclitaxel) + bevacizumab continuation

schedule_detailed.maintenance: Bevacizumab continuation (if started) up to 15 months total OR progression
schedule_detailed.typical_duration: ~18 weeks induction (6 cycles × 3 weeks) + up to 12 months maintenance

adjustments.delay: Up to 2 weeks for recovery from toxicity
adjustments.discontinuation: Disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, patient preference

during_treatment: CBC before each cycle (watch for cytopenias)
Blood pressure every visit (if on bevacizumab)
toxicity_watch: Peripheral neuropathy (paclitaxel) - consider dose reduction if Grade ≥2
Thrombocytopenia (carboplatin) - hold if platelets <100K, reduce if persistent
GI perforation risk (bevacizumab) - educate patient on warning signs
Hypertension (bevacizumab) - target BP <140/90, add antihypertensives if needed
monitoring_protocol.response_assessment: RECIST 1.1 criteria + CA-125 GCIG criteria (confirmed by repeat measurement)

confidence_gate_reasons: NCCN Category 1 recommendation for Stage IVB HGSOC
Carboplatin + Paclitaxel is standard frontline therapy
Bevacizumab add-on indicated for ascites/peritoneal disease (GOG-218, ICON7)
soc_recommendation.rationale: NCCN first-line for Stage IVB high-grade serous ovarian cancer

evidence.carboplatin_paclitaxel: Standard of care (multiple Phase III trials)

soc_recommendation.monitoring: CA-125 every cycle, imaging every 3 cycles
soc_recommendation.clinical_notes: This is a guideline-based recommendation (NOT prediction). Actual regimen selection should be made by treating oncologist considering patient-specific factors (performance status, organ function, comorbidities).

forecast.note: Baseline CA-125 not available. General expectations: ≥70% drop by cycle 3, ≥90% by cycle 6 for chemo-sensitive disease.

monitoring_strategy.rationale: High baseline; track any changes before treatment

ca125_intelligence.clinical_notes: CA-125 of 2842.0 U/mL indicates EXTENSIVE disease burden (>1,000). CA-125 is highly trackable and suitable for response monitoring. Complete response target: <35 U/mL. Additional therapy cycles likely needed.

wiwfm.message: Personalized drug efficacy predictions require tumor NGS data (somatic mutations, HRD, TMB, MSI)

ngs_fast_track.ctDNA: Guardant360 - somatic BRCA/HRR, TMB, MSI (7-10 days)
ngs_fast_track.tissue_HRD: MyChoice - HRD score for PARP maintenance planning (7-14 days)
ngs_fast_track.IHC: WT1/PAX8/p53 - confirm high-grade serous histology (1-3 days)

wiwfm.note: Once NGS available, WIWFM will provide Evo2-powered S/P/E drug ranking with 70-85% confidence

recommendations.test_name: HRD Score (MyChoice CDx or tissue-based NGS)
recommendations.cost_estimate: $4,000-$6,000 (typically covered by insurance for Stage III/IV ovarian)
recommendations.impact_if_positive: HRD ≥42 → PARP maintenance eligible (NCCN Category 1), confidence 90% for olaparib/niraparib/rucaparib. Unlock mechanism map DDR chip (green if ≥0.70).
recommendations.impact_if_negative: HRD <42 → PARP reduced benefit (confidence 60%), consider ATR/CHK1 combo trials (NCT03462342, NCT02264678) or platinum-based standard without PARP maintenance.
recommendations.rationale: HRD score determines PARP inhibitor eligibility and confidence level. Critical for first-line maintenance decision after platinum response. Germline-negative patients can still have somatic HRD.
recommendations.ordering_info: Order via Myriad Genetics (MyChoice CDx) or include in comprehensive tumor NGS panel. Requires FFPE tissue block or fresh tumor biopsy.

recommendations.test_name: ctDNA Comprehensive Panel (Guardant360 CDx or FoundationOne Liquid CDx)
recommendations.impact_if_positive: MSI-High OR TMB ≥20 → Immunotherapy eligible (pembrolizumab + chemo), confidence 85%. IO mechanism chip → green. Somatic BRCA1/BRCA2 or HRR mutations → PARP confidence 90% (even with germline-negative). DDR mechanism chip → green if somatic HRR detected.
recommendations.impact_if_negative: MSI-Stable AND TMB <20 → Immunotherapy lower priority (confidence 40%). IO mechanism chip → red. No somatic HRR → standard platinum backbone (no PARP unless tissue HRD ≥42).
recommendations.rationale: MSI/TMB unlock immunotherapy eligibility (critical in platinum-resistant setting). Somatic HRR mutations enable PARP strategies even when germline negative (15-20% of HGSOC). ctDNA faster than tissue (7d vs 10-14d) and tracks clonal evolution.
recommendations.ordering_info: Order via Guardant Health (Guardant360 CDx) or Foundation Medicine (FoundationOne Liquid CDx). Requires 2-3 tubes of blood (10mL EDTA). No tissue needed.

recommendations.impact_if_positive: SLFN11+ → Normal PARP sensitivity maintained, confidence 85%. Proceed with PARP maintenance if HRD ≥42. No adjustment to DDR mechanism burden.
recommendations.impact_if_negative: SLFN11- → Reduced PARP sensitivity (confidence drops to 50%), consider ATR/CHK1 or platinum-based alternatives. Flag in hint tiles: 'SLFN11 loss → favor ATR over PARP'.
recommendations.rationale: SLFN11 (Schlafen 11) expression correlates with PARP inhibitor response. Low/absent SLFN11 indicates intrinsic PARP resistance risk. Important for germline-negative patients where PARP benefit less certain.
recommendations.ordering_info: Order via pathology lab IHC panel. Requires FFPE tissue block (same block used for HRD/tumor NGS). Not always covered by insurance (check prior authorization).

top_priority.test_name: HRD Score (MyChoice CDx or tissue-based NGS)
top_priority.cost_estimate: $4,000-$6,000 (typically covered by insurance for Stage III/IV ovarian)
top_priority.impact_if_positive: HRD ≥42 → PARP maintenance eligible (NCCN Category 1), confidence 90% for olaparib/niraparib/rucaparib. Unlock mechanism map DDR chip (green if ≥0.70).
top_priority.impact_if_negative: HRD <42 → PARP reduced benefit (confidence 60%), consider ATR/CHK1 combo trials (NCT03462342, NCT02264678) or platinum-based standard without PARP maintenance.
top_priority.rationale: HRD score determines PARP inhibitor eligibility and confidence level. Critical for first-line maintenance decision after platinum response. Germline-negative patients can still have somatic HRD.
top_priority.ordering_info: Order via Myriad Genetics (MyChoice CDx) or include in comprehensive tumor NGS panel. Requires FFPE tissue block or fresh tumor biopsy.

next_test_recommender.checklist_markdown:
## 📋 NGS Fast-Track Checklist

### Priority 1: HRD Score
- **Test**: HRD Score (MyChoice CDx or tissue-based NGS)
- **Turnaround**: 10 days
- **Cost**: $4,000-$6,000 (typically covered by insurance for Stage III/IV ovarian)
- **Urgency**: HIGH

**What This Unlocks**:
- ✅ If Positive: HRD ≥42 → PARP maintenance eligible (NCCN Category 1), confidence 90% for olaparib/niraparib/rucaparib. Unlock mechanism map DDR chip (green if ≥0.70)...
- ⚠️ If Negative: HRD <42 → PARP reduced benefit (confidence 60%), consider ATR/CHK1 combo trials (NCT03462342, NCT02264678) or platinum-based standard without PARP mai...

**Why**: HRD score determines PARP inhibitor eligibility and confidence level. Critical for first-line maintenance decision after platinum response. Germline-negative patients can still have somatic HRD....

**Ordering**: Order via Myriad Genetics (MyChoice CDx) or include in comprehensive tumor NGS panel. Requires FFPE tissue block or fresh tumor biopsy.

---

### Priority 2: ctDNA Comprehensive Panel
- **Test**: ctDNA Comprehensive Panel (Guardant360 CDx or FoundationOne Liquid CDx)
- **Turnaround**: 7 days
- **Cost**: $5,000-$7,000 (typically covered by insurance)
- **Urgency**: HIGH

**What This Unlocks**:
- ✅ If Positive: MSI-High OR TMB ≥20 → Immunotherapy eligible (pembrolizumab + chemo), confidence 85%. IO mechanism chip → green. Somatic BRCA1/BRCA2 or HRR mutations ...
- ⚠️ If Negative: MSI-Stable AND TMB <20 → Immunotherapy lower priority (confidence 40%). IO mechanism chip → red. No somatic HRR → standard platinum backbone (no PARP ...

**Why**: MSI/TMB unlock immunotherapy eligibility (critical in platinum-resistant setting). Somatic HRR mutations enable PARP strategies even when germline negative (15-20% of HGSOC). ctDNA faster than tissue ...

**Ordering**: Order via Guardant Health (Guardant360 CDx) or Foundation Medicine (FoundationOne Liquid CDx). Requires 2-3 tubes of blood (10mL EDTA). No tissue needed.

---

### Priority 3: SLFN11 IHC
- **Test**: SLFN11 IHC (Immunohistochemistry)
- **Turnaround**: 5 days
- **Cost**: $300-$500
- **Urgency**: MEDIUM

**What This Unlocks**:
- ✅ If Positive: SLFN11+ → Normal PARP sensitivity maintained, confidence 85%. Proceed with PARP maintenance if HRD ≥42. No adjustment to DDR mechanism burden....
- ⚠️ If Negative: SLFN11- → Reduced PARP sensitivity (confidence drops to 50%), consider ATR/CHK1 or platinum-based alternatives. Flag in hint tiles: 'SLFN11 loss → fav...

**Why**: SLFN11 (Schlafen 11) expression correlates with PARP inhibitor response. Low/absent SLFN11 indicates intrinsic PARP resistance risk. Important for germline-negative patients where PARP benefit less ce...

**Ordering**: Order via pathology lab IHC panel. Requires FFPE tissue block (same block used for HRD/tumor NGS). Not always covered by insurance (check prior authorization).

---

provenance.note: Priority order: 1) HRD (PARP gate), 2) ctDNA (IO+DDR), 3) SLFN11 (PARP sensitivity), 4) ABCB1 (if prior taxane)

chips.label: Awaiting NGS
chips.tooltip: DNA damage repair pathway burden - requires tumor NGS to assess. High burden (≥70%) indicates PARP/ATR/CHK1 eligibility.

chips.label: Awaiting NGS
chips.tooltip: RAS/RAF/MEK pathway burden - requires tumor NGS. High burden (≥70%) indicates MEK/RAF inhibitor eligibility.

chips.label: Awaiting NGS
chips.tooltip: PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway burden - requires tumor NGS. High burden (≥70%) indicates PI3K/mTOR inhibitor eligibility.

chips.label: Awaiting NGS
chips.tooltip: Angiogenesis pathway burden - requires tumor NGS. High burden (≥70%) supports bevacizumab addition.

chips.label: Awaiting NGS
chips.tooltip: Immune checkpoint pathway - requires MSI/TMB testing. MSI-High OR TMB ≥20 → Immunotherapy eligible.

chips.label: Awaiting NGS
chips.tooltip: Drug efflux resistance (ABCB1) - requires tumor NGS. High expression → Cross-resistance to taxanes/anthracyclines.

mechanism_map.message: Mechanism map will be available once tumor NGS results are uploaded (7-10 days). Order HRD + ctDNA to unlock.

provenance.policy: All chips gray per Manager C9

summary.reasoning: Confidence is high for guideline-based recommendations (trials, SOC, CA-125). Confidence is moderate for personalized predictions (WIWFM requires NGS).

provenance.note: This is NOT a demo. Real clinical decision support for Ayesha's life.
